summary: hey it’s @legendarydefender or @kingriku
body:
hey it’s @legendarydefender or @kingriku

so tumblr decided to completely fuck me over and glitch when I changed my url, and now i can’t get into my blog that i’ve had for the past 6 years.

so here i am!! im not sure how long i’ll be on this blog but it’ll probably take a while to get my real blog back knowing tumblr. please spread this around so i can get at least some of my mutuals and followers back :)

if you didn’t know,

  • i’m caroline
  • i’m 18 and i’m from nyc
  • i was a vld blog for a very long time but have recently become multi fandom again, particularly focusing on andi mack, bnha, and kingdom hearts
  • i post gifsets and the occasional fanfic
  • known klance and lance stan

i love you all!! ❤️❤️

summary: Perfect Little Muffin Boy
body:
Perfect Little Muffin Boy

In which TJ gets his wisdom teeth taken out.

—————————————————————

Cyrus was plopped on his bed binging his favorite show, half a bag deep in cheez puffs, when he heard a ping come from his phone. He paused his show, trying to not get the orange dust on his phone, and opened the messages app.

basketball guy: heybfjdome overb

basketball guy: coemn ocef

basketball guy: cone ovet

Cyrus furrowed his eyebrows, and replied:

underdog: tj, are you alright?

basketball guy: yesg i’m ppercefktk fien

basketball guy: peerfely finr

basketball guy: i csnr see

Cyrus, worried, immediately wiped the cheez puff dust off his face, straightened out his hair, and ran down the stairs, announcing to his mom where he was going.

When Cyrus arrived at TJ’s house, he rang the doorbell, and TJ’s mom answered the door. Cyrus asked urgently, “Is TJ okay? He texted me to come over but he was making lots of typos and he said he couldn’t se—“

“He’s fine, Cyrus. He just got his wisdom teeth out,” the blonde woman replied, smiling. Cyrus took a breath as she added, “I’m actually kind of happy you’re here, I have to run some errands but I didn’t want to leave him alone. Are you okay with taking care of him for a bit?”

Cyrus smiled wide. “Totally.”

She stepped out of the doorway to allow Cyrus in, saying, “Great. He’s lying on the couch.” Cyrus gave her a thumbs up while she grabbed her things to leave. “I should be back in ten minutes, text me if you need anything, okay?”

“Will do,” Cyrus replied.

As TJ’s mom left, Cyrus made his way from the entry way to the living room to see TJ lying on the couch just as his mom said, wearing the sweatshirt from Cyrus’ bash mitzvah.

Cyrus immediately flushed red at the sight, while TJ, noticing him walk in, slurred, “Heeeey, underdog.”

“Hi, Teej.” Cyrus cleared his throat, trying to get over the fact that his crush was wearing a sweatshirt with his face on it. “How are you feeling?”

TJ, who looked like he could pass out at any second, mumbled, “Great, now that you’re here.”

Cyrus smiled, his face only growing more and more red. TJ continued, “You know, you’re like, my faaavorite person, you know?”

“You’re one of my favorite people, too, TJ,” Cyrus replied, wearing a smile on his face that was impossible to wipe off.

“‘S why I’m wearin’ this sweatshirt, because it’s got your face on it,” TJ added, mimicking an explosion with his mouth at the end. “That was like, a really good idea. You’re so smart, muffin boyyyy.”

Cyrus snorted, almost in disbelief of how adorable TJ was being, and of how much TJ was complimenting him. He tried to remind himself that TJ was just incredibly high on meds at the moment. “Thanks.”

TJ flung his arms behind his head so they were dangling off the arm of the couch as he continued to talk, almost unaware that Cyrus was actually paying attention to what he was saying. “You’re smaaart, and you’re cuuute, and you’re funny, you’re like…. perfect. Perfect little muffin boy.”

Cyrus felt like he was about to explode. Even though TJ was basically delirious, Cyrus couldn’t help but get all giddy over him and the fact that he was complimenting him over and over. “I wouldn’t say per—“

TJ almost inaudibly mumbled, interrupting Cyrus, “Perfect little muffin crush.”

Cyrus refused to believe he heard TJ correctly. “What?” he asked, almost laughing.

And of course, TJ had fallen asleep seconds prior. “What?” Cyrus repeated in a whisper, more to himself than anyone else.

———

Cyrus didn’t see or talk to TJ until the following Monday. He kept convincing himself that none of what TJ was saying on that Saturday was actually coherent or true, that TJ didn’t actually feel that way about him, he was just hopped up on meds, and there was no way that Big Hetero TJ Kippen could ever like him in the way that he did.

He tried pushing all of what happened out of his mind, at least until TJ approached him on that fated Monday morning. “Hey, Underdog! My mom told me you’d looked after me for a little bit on Saturday, just wanted to say thank you,” TJ said, a grin unwavering on his face.

Cyrus presses his lips into a flat line, trying to resemble a smile, and replied, “No problem.”

TJ added more quietly, “I didn’t say anything… weird, did I?”

And this is when Cyrus found himself in between a rock and a hard place. On the one hand, he wanted to tell TJ that he said he had a crush on him because he hated lying, but that could only lead to crushing disappointment since TJ would just confirm that he was super drugged out. On the other hand, he could lie to TJ to save his sanity, but he knew he’d go insane anyway because it would kill him to lie to TJ. So, Cyrus went with, “Well, you did say that you had a crush on me, but I’m sure that was just—“

“Shit,” TJ whispered.

Cyrus furrowed his eyebrows. “What?”

“N-nothing,” TJ responded, looking like a deer caught in headlights.

Cyrus softened his expression a bit, disbelief twinging his eyes. “Do you? Have a crush on me?”

TJ winced, rambling, “I mean, yeah, but I completely understand if you don’t feel the same way because why would you, I’m just some dumb jock who screws up all the time, but I’d really like to at least stay friends with you because you’re just—“

“A perfect little muffin boy?” Cyrus interrupted, amusement present in his tone.

TJ grimaced, “Is that what I said?”

“The first time,” Cyrus chuckled.

TJ’s eyes widened as he rambled again, “I don’t want to know what that means. Look, Cyrus, I’m so sorry if I made you feel uncomfortable at all, I never intended for—“

“Are you done rambling for no reason yet?” Cyrus interrupted yet again, a smile on his face this time.

TJ grew confused. “What do you mean?”

Cyrus nudged him on the shoulder, “I like you too, you dork.”

TJ’s eyes almost popped out of his head. “Really?”

Cyrus blushed lightly. “Yeah, really. You’re a perfect little basketball guy.”

TJ laughed, rolling his eyes. “So… what does that make us now?”

Cyrus shrugged hopefully, “Boyfriends?”

TJ flashed him a special grin. “I’d like that.”

On the one hand, he wanted to tell TJ that he said he had a crush on him because he hated lying, but that could only lead to crushing disappointment since TJ would just confirm that he was super drugged out. On the other hand, he could lie to TJ to save his sanity, but he knew he’d go insane anyway because it would kill him to lie to TJ. So, Cyrus went with, “Well, you did say that you had a crush on me, but I’m sure that was just—“

“Shit,” TJ whispered.

Cyrus furrowed his eyebrows. “What?”

“N-nothing,” TJ responded, looking like a deer caught in headlights.

Cyrus softened his expression a bit, disbelief twinging his eyes. “Do you? Have a crush on me?”

TJ winced, rambling, “I mean, yeah, but I completely understand if you don’t feel the same way because why would you, I’m just some dumb jock who screws up all the time, but I’d really like to at least stay friends with you because you’re just—“

“A perfect little muffin boy?” Cyrus interrupted, amusement present in his tone.

TJ grimaced, “Is that what I said?”

“The first time,” Cyrus chuckled.

TJ’s eyes widened as he rambled again, “I don’t want to know what that means. Look, Cyrus, I’m so sorry if I made you feel uncomfortable at all, I never intended for—“

“Are you done rambling for no reason yet?” Cyrus interrupted yet again, a smile on his face this time.

TJ grew confused. “What do you mean?”

Cyrus nudged him on the shoulder, “I like you too, you dork.”

TJ’s eyes almost popped out of his head. “Really?”

Cyrus blushed lightly. “Yeah, really. You’re a perfect little basketball guy.”

TJ laughed, rolling his eyes. “So… what does that make us now?”

Cyrus shrugged hopefully, “Boyfriends?”

TJ flashed him a special grin. “I’d like that.”
trail.content:
Perfect Little Muffin Boy

In which TJ gets his wisdom teeth taken out.

—————————————————————

Cyrus was plopped on his bed binging his favorite show, half a bag deep in cheez puffs, when he heard a ping come from his phone. He paused his show, trying to not get the orange dust on his phone, and opened the messages app.

basketball guy: heybfjdome overb

basketball guy: coemn ocef

basketball guy: cone ovet

Cyrus furrowed his eyebrows, and replied:

underdog: tj, are you alright?

basketball guy: yesg i’m ppercefktk fien

basketball guy: peerfely finr

basketball guy: i csnr see

Cyrus, worried, immediately wiped the cheez puff dust off his face, straightened out his hair, and ran down the stairs, announcing to his mom where he was going.

When Cyrus arrived at TJ’s house, he rang the doorbell, and TJ’s mom answered the door. Cyrus asked urgently, “Is TJ okay? He texted me to come over but he was making lots of typos and he said he couldn’t se—“

“He’s fine, Cyrus. He just got his wisdom teeth out,” the blonde woman replied, smiling. Cyrus took a breath as she added, “I’m actually kind of happy you’re here, I have to run some errands but I didn’t want to leave him alone. Are you okay with taking care of him for a bit?”

Cyrus smiled wide. “Totally.”

She stepped out of the doorway to allow Cyrus in, saying, “Great. He’s lying on the couch.” Cyrus gave her a thumbs up while she grabbed her things to leave. “I should be back in ten minutes, text me if you need anything, okay?”

“Will do,” Cyrus replied.

As TJ’s mom left, Cyrus made his way from the entry way to the living room to see TJ lying on the couch just as his mom said, wearing the sweatshirt from Cyrus’ bash mitzvah.

Cyrus immediately flushed red at the sight, while TJ, noticing him walk in, slurred, “Heeeey, underdog.”

“Hi, Teej.” Cyrus cleared his throat, trying to get over the fact that his crush was wearing a sweatshirt with his face on it. “How are you feeling?”

TJ, who looked like he could pass out at any second, mumbled, “Great, now that you’re here.”

Cyrus smiled, his face only growing more and more red. TJ continued, “You know, you’re like, my faaavorite person, you know?”

“You’re one of my favorite people, too, TJ,” Cyrus replied, wearing a smile on his face that was impossible to wipe off.

“‘S why I’m wearin’ this sweatshirt, because it’s got your face on it,” TJ added, mimicking an explosion with his mouth at the end. “That was like, a really good idea. You’re so smart, muffin boyyyy.”

Cyrus snorted, almost in disbelief of how adorable TJ was being, and of how much TJ was complimenting him. He tried to remind himself that TJ was just incredibly high on meds at the moment. “Thanks.”

TJ flung his arms behind his head so they were dangling off the arm of the couch as he continued to talk, almost unaware that Cyrus was actually paying attention to what he was saying. “You’re smaaart, and you’re cuuute, and you’re funny, you’re like…. perfect. Perfect little muffin boy.”

Cyrus felt like he was about to explode. Even though TJ was basically delirious, Cyrus couldn’t help but get all giddy over him and the fact that he was complimenting him over and over. “I wouldn’t say per—“

TJ almost inaudibly mumbled, interrupting Cyrus, “Perfect little muffin crush.”

Cyrus refused to believe he heard TJ correctly. “What?” he asked, almost laughing.

And of course, TJ had fallen asleep seconds prior. “What?” Cyrus repeated in a whisper, more to himself than anyone else.

———

Cyrus didn’t see or talk to TJ until the following Monday. He kept convincing himself that none of what TJ was saying on that Saturday was actually coherent or true, that TJ didn’t actually feel that way about him, he was just hopped up on meds, and there was no way that Big Hetero TJ Kippen could ever like him in the way that he did.

He tried pushing all of what happened out of his mind, at least until TJ approached him on that fated Monday morning. “Hey, Underdog! My mom told me you’d looked after me for a little bit on Saturday, just wanted to say thank you,” TJ said, a grin unwavering on his face.

Cyrus presses his lips into a flat line, trying to resemble a smile, and replied, “No problem.”

TJ added more quietly, “I didn’t say anything… weird, did I?”

And this is when Cyrus found himself in between a rock and a hard place. On the one hand, he wanted to tell TJ that he said he had a crush on him because he hated lying, but that could only lead to crushing disappointment since TJ would just confirm that he was super drugged out. On the other hand, he could lie to TJ to save his sanity, but he knew he’d go insane anyway because it would kill him to lie to TJ. So, Cyrus went with, “Well, you did say that you had a crush on me, but I’m sure that was just—“

“Shit,” TJ whispered.

Cyrus furrowed his eyebrows. “What?”

“N-nothing,” TJ responded, looking like a deer caught in headlights.

Cyrus softened his expression a bit, disbelief twinging his eyes. “Do you? Have a crush on me?”

TJ winced, rambling, “I mean, yeah, but I completely understand if you don’t feel the same way because why would you, I’m just some dumb jock who screws up all the time, but I’d really like to at least stay friends with you because you’re just—“

“A perfect little muffin boy?” Cyrus interrupted, amusement present in his tone.

TJ grimaced, “Is that what I said?”

“The first time,” Cyrus chuckled.

TJ’s eyes widened as he rambled again, “I don’t want to know what that means. Look, Cyrus, I’m so sorry if I made you feel uncomfortable at all, I never intended for—“

“Are you done rambling for no reason yet?” Cyrus interrupted yet again, a smile on his face this time.

TJ grew confused. “What do you mean?”

Cyrus nudged him on the shoulder, “I like you too, you dork.”

TJ’s eyes almost popped out of his head. “Really?”

Cyrus blushed lightly. “Yeah, really. You’re a perfect little basketball guy.”

TJ laughed, rolling his eyes. “So… what does that make us now?”

Cyrus shrugged hopefully, “Boyfriends?”

TJ flashed him a special grin. “I’d like that.”

summary: people get mad because cyrus isn’t “gay enough” or his gayness was “erased” but kevin keller is out here on riverdale only for...
